segment: Health officials have been urging dairy workers to wear personal protective equipment [PPE] in milking parlors, for example, given the sky-high levels of virus [H5N1] in cows’ udders and their milk. But milking parlors can be hot and stuffy, meaning it [wearing PPE]’s not comfortable or feasible to wear masks and goggles.
